intro: Vinca minor flore-pleno, commonly known as the spreading jeweled vine, is a low-growing evergreen perennial that features dense, mat-forming growth. Its botanical characteristics include heart-shaped, dark green leaves that remain lush throughout the growing season. The plant produces clusters of bright, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, or violet, depending on the cultivar. It thrives in partial to full shade and is well-suited for ground cover in woodland gardens. Vinca minor flore-pleno is known for its hardiness and ability to tolerate a variety of soil conditions.
